%text For the following relation \[ \quad R = \left\lbrace (x,y)\,\vert\, x,y\in\W, x^2 + y^2 = 25 \right\rbrace\]
\[ \text{Domain} = \text{Range} = \left\lbrace 0,3,4,5\right\rbrace\] %

reason.tex: %text $x$ and $y$ are supposed to be whole numbers $(x,y\in\W = \mathbb{N} + \left\lbrace 0\right\rbrace)$ Moreover, they must also satisfy the condition $x^2 + y^2 = 25$ This is possible only for the following pairs \[ \quad R = \overbrace{\underbrace{\left\lbrace (0,5),(3,4),(4,3),(5,0) \right\rbrace}_{\text{Range = All $y's$}}}^{\text{Domain = All $x's$}}\] Which is why \[ \quad \text{Domain} = \text{Range} = \left\lbrace 0,3,4,5\right\rbrace\] %
